alert.note: Alert for East Slopes of the Washington Cascades (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Avalanche Warning issued January 02 at 6:57PM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: THE FOLLOWING MESSAGE IS TRANSMITTED AT THE REQUEST OF THE NORTHWEST AVALANCHE CENTER. ...THE NORTHWEST AVALANCHE CENTER IN SEATTLE HAS ISSUED AN AVALANCHE WARNING... * WHAT...HIGH AVALANCHE DANGER WILL DEVELOP SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY IN THE WARNING AREAS. * WHERE...THE MT HOOD AREA AND THE EAST SLOPES OF THE WASHINGTON CASCADES SOUTH OF I-90. * WHEN...IN EFFECT FROM JAN 2ND SUN 18:00 PST THROUGH JAN 3RD MON 18:00 PST. * IMPACTS...HEAVY SNOW AND EXTREME WINDS WILL CREATE VERY DANGEROUS AVALANCHE CONDITIONS THROUGH MONDAY. LARGE AVALANCHES ARE VERY LIKELY. * PRECAUTIONARY / PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...BACKCOUNTRY TRAVEL IS NOT RECOMMENDED. AVOID TRAVELING IN AREAS WHERE LARGE AVALANCHE CAN RUN, START OR STOP. CONSULT HTTPS://WWW.NWAC.US/ OR WWW.AVALANCHE.ORG FOR MORE DETAILED INFORMATION.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes of the Washington Cascades
